   17: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------
   18: %% @author Maxim Fedorov <maximfca@gmail.com>
   19: %% Basic heap profiler tests.
   20: -module(tprof_SUITE).
   21: -author("maximfca@gmail.com").
   22: 
   23: %% Test server callbacks
   24: -export([suite/0, all/0]).
   25: 
   26: %% Test cases exports
   27: -export([
   28:     call_count_ad_hoc/0, call_count_ad_hoc/1,
   29:     call_time_ad_hoc/0, call_time_ad_hoc/1,
   30:     call_memory_ad_hoc/0, call_memory_ad_hoc/1,
   31:     sort/0, sort/1,
   32:     rootset/0, rootset/1,
   33:     set_on_spawn/0, set_on_spawn/1, seq/1,
   34:     live_trace/0, live_trace/1,
   35:     patterns/0, patterns/1, pattern_fun/1, pattern_fun/2, pattern_fun/3,
   36:     processes/0, processes/1,
   37:     server/0, server/1,
   38:     hierarchy/0, hierarchy/1,
   39:     code_reload/0, code_reload/1
   40: ]).
   41: 
   42: -include_lib("stdlib/include/assert.hrl").
   43: 
   44: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   45: %% COMMON TEST CALLBACK FUNCTIONS
   46: 
   47: suite() ->
   48:     [{timetrap, {seconds, 60}}].
   49: 
   50: all() ->
   51:     [call_count_ad_hoc, call_time_ad_hoc, call_memory_ad_hoc,
   52:      sort, rootset, set_on_spawn, live_trace, patterns,
   53:      processes, server, hierarchy, code_reload].
   54: 
   55: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   56: %% TEST CASES
   57: 
   58: call_count_ad_hoc() ->
   59:     [{doc, "Ad-hoc examples for call_count measurement"}].
   60: 
   61: call_count_ad_hoc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   62:     ct:capture_start(),
   63:     ok = tprof:profile(lists, seq, [1, 16]),
   64:     ct:capture_stop(),
   65:     Output = string:lexemes(lists:flatten(ct:capture_get()), "\n"),
   66:     %% expect one line to contain lists:seq_loop: "lists:seq_loop/3    5   [  ...]",
   67:     true =
   68:         lists:any(
   69:             fun
   70:                 ("lists:seq_loop/3" ++ Rest) ->
   71:                     [_, "[", _] = string:lexemes(Rest, " "),
   72:                     true;
   73:                 (_) ->
   74:                     false
   75:             end,
   76:             Output
   77:         ),
   78:     %% spawn examples
   79:     SpawnFun =
   80:         fun () ->
   81:             {Pid, MRef} = spawn_monitor(fun () -> lists:seq(1, 32) end),
   82:             receive {'DOWN', MRef, process, Pid, normal} -> done end
   83:        end,
   84:     %% trace subset examples
   85:     {done, Profile1} = tprof:profile(SpawnFun, #{pattern => [{lists, seq_loop, '_'}], report => return, type => call_count}),
   86:     ?assertMatch({call_count, [{lists, seq_loop, 3, [{all, _, _}]}]}, Profile1),
   87:     %% timer
   88:     {{'EXIT', timeout}, Profile2} = tprof:profile(
   89:         fun () -> Delay = hd(lists:seq(5001, 5032)), timer:sleep(Delay) end,
   90:         #{timeout => 1000, report => return, type => call_count,
   91:           pattern => [{lists, seq_loop, '_'}]}),
   92:     ?assertMatch({call_count, [{lists, seq_loop, 3, [{all, _, _}]}]}, Profile2).
   93: 
   94: call_time_ad_hoc() ->
   95:     [{doc, "Ad-hoc examples for call_time measurement"}].
   96: 
   97: call_time_ad_hoc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   98:     ct:capture_start(),
   99:     ok = tprof:profile(lists, seq, [1, 16], #{type => call_time}),
  100:     ct:capture_stop(),
  101:     Output = string:lexemes(lists:flatten(ct:capture_get()), "\n"),
  102:     %% expect one line to contain lists:seq_loop: "lists:seq_loop/3    5   ...   ...  [...]",
  103:     true =
  104:         lists:any(
  105:             fun
  106:                 ("lists:seq_loop/3" ++ Rest) ->
  107:                     ["5", _, _, "[" ++ _ | _] = string:lexemes(Rest, " "),
  108:                     true;
  109:                 (_) ->
  110:                     false
  111:             end,
  112:             Output
  113:         ),
  114:     %% spawn examples
  115:     SpawnFun =
  116:         fun () ->
  117:             {Pid, MRef} = spawn_monitor(fun () -> lists:seq(1, 32) end),
  118:             receive {'DOWN', MRef, process, Pid, normal} -> done end
  119:        end,
  120:     %% trace subset examples
  121:     {done, Profile1} = tprof:profile(SpawnFun, #{pattern => [{lists, seq_loop, '_'}], report => return, type => call_time}),
  122:     ?assertMatch({call_time, [{lists, seq_loop, 3, [{_, 9, _}]}]}, Profile1),
  123:     %% timer
  124:     {{'EXIT', timeout}, Profile2} = tprof:profile(
  125:         fun () -> Delay = hd(lists:seq(5001, 5032)), timer:sleep(Delay) end,
  126:         #{timeout => 1000, report => return, type => call_time,
  127:           pattern => [{lists, seq_loop, '_'}]}),
  128:     ?assertMatch({call_time, [{lists, seq_loop, 3, [{_, 9, _}]}]}, Profile2).
  129: 
  130: call_memory_ad_hoc() ->
  131:     [{doc, "Ad-hoc examples for call_memory measurement"}].
  132: 
  133: call_memory_ad_hoc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  134:     ct:capture_start(),
  135:     ok = tprof:profile(lists, seq, [1, 16], #{type => call_memory}),
  136:     ct:capture_stop(),
  137:     Output = string:lexemes(lists:flatten(ct:capture_get()), "\n"),
  138:     %% expect third line to contain lists:seq_loop: "lists:seq_loop/3   5     32   6.40  [...]",
  139:     ?assertMatch(["lists:seq_loop/3", "5", "32", _, "[" ++ _ | _], string:lexemes(lists:nth(3, Output), " ")),
  140:     %% spawn examples
  141:     SpawnFun =
  142:         fun () ->
  143:             {Pid, MRef} = spawn_monitor(fun () -> lists:seq(1, 32) end),
  144:             receive {'DOWN', MRef, process, Pid, normal} -> done end
  145:        end,
  146:     %% trace subset examples
  147:     {done, Profile1} = tprof:profile(SpawnFun, #{pattern => [{lists, seq_loop, '_'}], report => return, type => call_memory}),
  148:     ?assertMatch({call_memory, [{lists, seq_loop, 3, [{_, 9, 64}]}]}, Profile1),
  149:     %% timer
  150:     {{'EXIT', timeout}, Profile2} = tprof:profile(
  151:         fun () -> Delay = hd(lists:seq(5001, 5032)), timer:sleep(Delay) end,
  152:         #{timeout => 1000, report => return, type => call_memory}),
  153:     ?assertMatch({call_memory, [{lists, seq_loop, 3, [{_, 9, 64}]}]}, Profile2).
  154: 
  155: sort() ->
  156:     [{doc, "Tests sorting methods work"}].
  157: 
  158: sort(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  159:     %% sort examples
  160:     ct:capture_start(),
  161:     ok = tprof:profile(
  162:         fun () ->
  163:             Group = lists:seq(100, 120),
  164:             rand:uniform(hd(Group))
  165:         end, #{report => {process, {measurement_per_call, descending}}, type => call_memory}),
  166:     ct:capture_stop(),
  167:     Out = string:lexemes(lists:flatten(ct:capture_get()), "\n"),
  168:     %% measurement per call is 5th column
  169:     Col = 5,
  170:     Column5 = [string:to_integer(lists:nth(Col, Lexemes)) || Ln <- Out,
  171:         length(Lexemes = string:lexemes(Ln, " ")) >= Col],
  172:     WPC = [Words || {Words, []} <- Column5],
  173:     %% ensure descending sort
  174:     ?assertEqual(lists:reverse(lists:sort(WPC)), WPC).
  175: 
  176: rootset() ->
  177:     [{doc, "Tests rootset of processes supplied to ad-hoc profiler"}].
  178: 
  179: rootset(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  180:     TestCase = ?FUNCTION_NAME,
  181:     {ok, Scope} = pg:start_link(TestCase),
  182:     Fun = fun () -> ok = pg:join(TestCase, lists:seq(1, 2), self()) end,
  183:     %% rootset tests
  184:     {ok, Profile} = tprof:profile(Fun, #{rootset => [TestCase], report => return, type => call_memory}),
  185:     TwoProcs = tprof:inspect(Profile),
  186:     ?assertEqual(2, maps:size(TwoProcs)), %% must be pg and "profiled process"
  187:     %% now trace all processes, existing and new
  188:     {ok, ProfAll} = tprof:profile(Fun, #{rootset => processes, report => return, type => call_memory}),
  189:     %% at least tprof, pg2 and new profiled processes are traced
  190:     ?assert(map_size(tprof:inspect(ProfAll)) >= 3),
  191:     gen_server:stop(Scope).
  192: 
  193: set_on_spawn() ->
  194:     [{doc, "Tests tprof running with extra spawned processes"}].
  195: 
  196: set_on_spawn(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  197:     %% profile a function that spawns additional process
  198:     {done, Profile} = tprof:profile(
  199:         fun () ->
  200:             {Pid, MRef} = spawn_monitor(fun () -> lists:seq(1, 32) end),
  201:             receive {'DOWN', MRef, process, Pid, normal} -> done end
  202:         end, #{report => return, set_on_spawn => false, type => call_memory}),
  203:     {done, ProfileMFA} = tprof:profile(?MODULE, seq, [32], #{report => return, set_on_spawn => false, type => call_memory}),
  204:     %% check totals
  205:     #{all := {call_memory, _G1, TotalProfile}} = tprof:inspect(Profile, total, measurement),
  206:     #{all := {call_memory, _G2, TotalProfileMFA}} = tprof:inspect(ProfileMFA, total, measurement),
  207:     %% only 1 process must be there
  208:     ?assertEqual(1, maps:size(tprof:inspect(Profile)), {set_on_spawn, Profile}),
  209:     %% check per-process stats
  210:     case erlang:system_info(wordsize) of
  211:         8 -> ?assertMatch({?MODULE, {_, 0}, 1, 9, 9.0, _}, lists:keyfind(?MODULE, 1, TotalProfile));
  212:         4 -> ?assertMatch({?MODULE, {_, 0}, 1, 10, 10.0, _}, lists:keyfind(?MODULE, 1, TotalProfile))
  213:     end,
  214:     %% MFA takes 6 more words. This test should be improved to depend less on the internal
  215:     %%  implementation.
  216:     case erlang:system_info(wordsize) of
  217:         8 -> ?assertMatch({?MODULE, {seq, 1}, 1, 13, 13.0, _}, lists:keyfind(?MODULE, 1, TotalProfileMFA));
  218:         4 -> ?assertMatch({?MODULE, {seq, 1}, 1, 14, 14.0, _}, lists:keyfind(?MODULE, 1, TotalProfileMFA))
  219:     end.
  220: 
  221: seq(Max) ->
  222:     {Pid, MRef} = spawn_monitor(fun () -> lists:seq(1, Max) end),
  223:     receive {'DOWN', MRef, process, Pid, normal} -> done end.
  224: 
  225: live_trace() ->
  226:     [{doc, "Tests memory tracing for pre-existing processes"}].
  227: 
  228: live_trace(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  229:     {ok, _Srv} = tprof:start_link(#{type => call_memory}),
  230:     Pid = spawn_link(
  231:         fun () ->
  232:             receive
  233:                 {From, C} ->
  234:                     [lists:seq(1, 2) || _ <- lists:seq(1, C)],
  235:                     From ! {self(), done}
  236:             end
  237:         end),
  238:     _ = tprof:set_pattern(?MODULE, '_', '_'),
  239:     1 = tprof:enable_trace(Pid),
  240:     Pid ! {self(), 12},
  241:     receive {Pid, done} -> ok end,
  242:     catch tprof:disable_trace(Pid),
  243:     Profile = tprof:collect(),
  244:     ProcInspected = tprof:inspect(Profile),
  245:     %% white box check: list comprehension with 1-arity, and 100% allocation
  246:     %% tprof:format(user, ProcInspected),
  247:     #{Pid := {call_memory, 48, [{?MODULE, {_LC, 1}, 13, 48, _, 100.0}]}} = ProcInspected,
  248:     tprof:stop().
  249: 
  250: patterns() ->
  251:     [{doc, "Tests pattern enable/disable correctness"}].
  252: 
  253: patterns(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  254:     {ok, _Srv} = tprof:start_link(#{type => call_memory}),
  255:     %% test errors
  256:     ?assertEqual({error, {not_traced, pg, get_members, '_'}}, tprof:clear_pattern(pg, get_members, '_')),
  257:     ?assertEqual({error, {trace_pattern, ?MODULE, seq, 2}}, tprof:set_pattern(?MODULE, seq, 2)),
  258:     %% successful patterns
  259:     1 = tprof:set_pattern(?MODULE, seq, 1),
  260:     3 = tprof:set_pattern(?MODULE, pattern_fun, '_'),
  261:     1 = tprof:clear_pattern(?MODULE, pattern_fun, 2),
  262:     Expected = [{pattern_fun, 1}, {pattern_fun, 3}, {seq, 1}],
  263:     ?assertEqual(#{?MODULE => Expected}, tprof:get_trace_map()),
  264:     %% verify tracing flags
  265:     verify_trace([{?MODULE, F, A} || {F, A} <- Expected], [{?MODULE, pattern_fun, 2}]),
  266:     %% trace the entire lists module, and then exclude pattern_fun/1,2,3 and seq/1
  267:     _ = tprof:set_pattern(?MODULE, '_', '_'),
  268:     3 = tprof:clear_pattern(?MODULE, pattern_fun, '_'),
  269:     1 = tprof:clear_pattern(?MODULE, seq, 1),
  270:     Cleared = [{pattern_fun, 1}, {pattern_fun, 2}, {pattern_fun, 3}, {seq, 1}],
  271:     Traced = ?MODULE:module_info(functions) -- Cleared,
  272:     verify_trace([{?MODULE, F, A} || {F, A} <- Traced], [{?MODULE, F, A} || {F, A} <- Cleared]),
  273:     %% clear all, which clears lists too
  274:     _ = tprof:clear_pattern('_', '_', '_'),
  275:     verify_trace([], [{?MODULE, F, A} || {F, A} <- Traced ++ Cleared]),
  276:     ?assertEqual(#{}, tprof:get_trace_map()),
  277:     tprof:stop().
  278: 
  279: verify_trace(On, Off) ->
  280:     [?assertEqual({call_memory, []}, erlang:trace_info(MFA, call_memory)) || MFA <- On],
  281:     [?assertEqual({call_memory, false}, erlang:trace_info(MFA, call_memory)) || MFA <- Off].
  282: 
  283: pattern_fun(Any) -> Any.
  284: pattern_fun(Any, Any2) -> {Any, Any2}.
  285: pattern_fun(Any, Any2, Any3) -> {Any, Any2, Any3}.
  286: 
  287: processes() ->
  288:     [{doc, "Tests that process management for enabling/disabling traces works"}].
  289: 
  290: processes(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  291:     Pid = spawn_link(fun spawn_loop/0),
  292:     Pid2 = spawn_link(fun spawn_loop/0),
  293:     register(?FUNCTION_NAME, Pid2),
  294:     %% test a mix of pids/registered processes/single PID calls
  295:     ?assertEqual(2, tprof:enable_trace([Pid, Pid2])),
  296:     ?assertEqual(0, tprof:disable_trace('$sure_not_exist')),
  297:     ?assertEqual({1, ['$sure_not_exist']}, tprof:enable_trace([Pid, '$sure_not_exist'])),
  298:     ok = gen:stop(Pid),
  299:     ok = gen:stop(Pid2).
  300: 
  301: server() ->
  302:     [{doc, "Tests for gen_server-based API"}].
  303: 
  304: server(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  305:     %% start an extra pg scope - we'll trace it during profiling
  306:     {ok, Scope} = pg:start_link(?FUNCTION_NAME),
  307:     %% simulate existing process
  308:     Pid = spawn_link(fun spawn_loop/0),
  309:     %% start the profiler
  310:     {ok, Srv} = tprof:start_link(#{type => call_memory}),
  311:     %% test ad-hoc profile clash
  312:     ?assertException(error, {already_started, Srv}, tprof:profile(fun spawn_loop/0)),
  313:     %% test live trace
  314:     1 = tprof:set_pattern(?MODULE, dispatch, '_'),
  315:     _ = tprof:set_pattern(pg, '_', '_'),
  316:     %% watch for pg traces and for our process
  317:     2 = tprof:enable_trace([Pid, ?FUNCTION_NAME]),
  318:     %% run the traced operation
  319:     _ = gen_server:call(Pid, {apply, pg, join, [?FUNCTION_NAME, group, Pid]}),
  320:     %% collect profile (can save it to a file for later analysis)
  321:     {call_memory, FirstProfile} = tprof:collect(),
  322:     %% must not be empty, and must contain 3-words dispatch from this module,
  323:     %%  and at least something from pg in two processes
  324:     ?assertNotEqual([], FirstProfile),
  325:     ?assertEqual({?MODULE, dispatch, 2, [{Pid, 1, 3}]}, lists:keyfind(?MODULE, 1, FirstProfile)),
  326:     ?assertMatch({pg, handle_call, 3, [{Scope, _, _}]}, lists:keyfind(handle_call, 2, FirstProfile)),
  327:     ?assertMatch({pg, join, 3, [{Pid, _, _}]}, lists:keyfind(join, 2, FirstProfile)),
  328:     %% pause tracing
  329:     ok = tprof:pause(),
  330:     %% ensure paused by running more code but keeping the trace
  331:     %% ensure collection still returns the previous result
  332:     _ = gen_server:call(Pid, {apply, pg, join, [?FUNCTION_NAME, group, Pid]}),
  333:     {call_memory, FirstProfile} = tprof:collect(),
  334:     %% continue, ensure new results are collected
  335:     ok = tprof:continue(),
  336:     _ = gen_server:call(Pid, {apply, pg, leave, [?FUNCTION_NAME, group, [Pid, Pid]]}),
  337:     ?assertNotEqual({call_memory, FirstProfile}, tprof:collect()),
  338:     %% restart all counters from zero and ensure that we again collect the original data
  339:     ok = tprof:restart(),
  340:     _ = gen_server:call(Pid, {apply, pg, join, [?FUNCTION_NAME, group, Pid]}),
  341:     {call_memory, FirstProfile} = tprof:collect(),
  342: 
  343:     %% test ad-hoc profiling can be done while running server-aided
  344:     %% for that, profiler should have very specific pattern
  345:     {_, AdHoc} = tprof:profile(lists, seq, [1, 32], #{registered => false, pattern => {lists, '_', '_'},
  346:         report => return, type => call_memory}),
  347:     %% check totals: must be 64 words allocated by a single lists:seq_loop
  348:     ?assertMatch(#{all := {call_memory, 64, [{lists, _, _, 64, _, _}]}},
  349:                  tprof:inspect(AdHoc, total, measurement)),
  350:     %% verify that server-aided version still works
  351:     {call_memory, FirstProfile} = tprof:collect(),
  352:     ok = tprof:stop(),
  353:     ok = gen_server:stop(Scope),
  354:     ok = gen:stop(Pid).
  355: 
  356: %% nano-gen-server purely for tracing
  357: spawn_loop() ->
  358:     receive
  359:         {'$gen_call', From, Call} ->
  360:             dispatch(Call, From),
  361:             spawn_loop();
  362:         {system, From, {terminate,normal}} ->
  363:             gen:reply(From, ok)
  364:     end.
  365: 
  366: dispatch({spawn_link, Fun}, From) ->
  367:     gen:reply(From, erlang:spawn_link(Fun));
  368: dispatch({apply, M, F, A}, From) ->
  369:     gen:reply(From, erlang:apply(M, F, A)).
  370: 
  371: hierarchy() ->
  372:     [{doc, "Tests tracing for process hierarchy"}].
  373: 
  374: hierarchy(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  375:     {ok, _Srv} = tprof:start_link(#{type => call_memory}),
  376:     Traced = tprof:enable_trace({all_children, kernel_sup}),
  377:     ?assert(Traced > 5),
  378:     ?assert(tprof:set_pattern(code_server, '_', '_') > 5),
  379:     _ = code:get_path(), %% makes a call to code_server
  380:     %% disabling all processes tracing should return more than "children of"
  381:     ?assert(tprof:disable_trace(processes) > Traced),
  382:     {call_memory, Profile} = tprof:collect(),
  383:     tprof:stop(),
  384:     ?assertNotEqual(false, lists:keyfind(handle_call, 2, Profile)).
  385: 
  386: code_reload() ->
  387:     [{doc, "Tests that collection does not fail for a hot-code-reloaded module"}].
  388: 
  389: code_reload(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  390:     Sample = tprof:profile(fun () -> code:load_file(?MODULE) end, #{report => return, type => call_memory}),
  391:     %% don't care about actual returned values, but do care that profile/2 does not crash
  392:     ?assertNotEqual([], Sample).
